name: Titanium.Media.AudioPlayer
summary: An audio player object used for streaming audio to the device, and low-level control of the audio playback.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired when the state of the playback changes.
events.description: This event can be generated by programmatic events, such as pausing or stopping the audio, and also by external events, such as the current state of network buffering.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: Current state of playback.

properties.name: description
properties.summary: Text description of the state of playback.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: complete
events.summary: Fired when the audio has finished playing.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates if the sound was played successfully. Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. Error code will be 0 if success is true, nonzero otherwise. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: metadata
events.summary: Fired when the timed metadata was encountered most recently within the media as it plays.
events.description: Use this event to receive meta information about real time streams and buffers, for example the title of an active radio stream. Read more about timed metadata in the Apple docs.

properties.name: items
properties.summary: An array of metadata items containing relevant information about the current media item.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. Different between android and iOS.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: progress
events.summary: Fired once per second with the current progress during playback.

properties.name: progress
properties.summary: Current progress, in milliseconds.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: finished
properties.summary: The event for any prior seek request that is still in process will be invoked immediately with the finished parameter set to false. If the new request completes without being interrupted by another seek request or by any other operation this event will be invoked with the finished parameter set to true.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: pause
methods.description:
On iOS, the pause call operates as a toggle. If the stream is already paused, calling pause again resumes playing the stream.

On Android, the pause call does nothing if the stream is already paused.

On both platforms, calling start on a paused stream resumes play.

methods.name: release
methods.summary: Stops buffering audio data and releases audio resources.
methods.description:
On Android, this method should be called when you are done streaming a given audio object, to release underlying resources, including buffered data.

On iOS, this method can be called for parity to release the current player instance and it's observers. Note: If you are listening to the progress event, you should remove and re-add the event listener.

methods.name: seekToTime
methods.summary: Moves the playback cursor and invokes the specified block when the seek operation has either been completed or been interrupted.
methods.description: Use this method to seek to a specified time for the current player item and to be notified by the seek event when the seek operation is complete.

parameters.name: time
parameters.summary: The time in milliseconds to seek to.

methods.name: setPaused
methods.description: On iOS, this method can be used to pause and unpause playback. For portability, it is preferable to use the pause and start methods instead.

parameters.name: paused
parameters.summary: Pass true to pause the current playback temporarily, false to unpause it.

methods.name: stateDescription
methods.summary: Converts a state value into a text description suitable for display.

properties.name: allowBackground
properties.summary: Boolean to indicate if audio should continue playing even if the associated Android Titanium.Android.Activity is paused.
properties.description: Setting allowBackground to true allows the audio to continue playing, for example, if the application is in the background.

properties.name: allowsExternalPlayback
properties.summary: Indicates whether the player allows switching to "external playback" mode.

properties.name: audioFocus
properties.summary: Focuses on the current audio player and stops other audio playing.
properties.description: If true then all other audio sources will be stopped when Titanium.AudioPlayer is started or resumed.

properties.name: audioType
properties.summary: Changes the audio-stream-type.

properties.name: autoplay
properties.summary: Indicates if the audio should automatically start playback.

properties.name: bitRate
properties.summary: Bit rate of the current playback stream.

properties.name: bufferSize
properties.summary: Size of the buffer used for streaming, in milliseconds.
properties.description: Prior to Titanium 7.5.0, this property was set in bytes. Since the internal iOS API moved to the more modern AVPlayer, this property now works with milliseconds instead.

properties.name: duration
properties.summary: Estimated duration in milliseconds of the file being played.
properties.description: May return 0 when playing a live stream.

properties.name: externalPlaybackActive
properties.summary: Indicates whether the player is currently playing video in "external playback" mode.

properties.name: idle
properties.summary: Boolean indicating if the player is idle.
properties.description: true if the player is in the initialized state: that is, not playing, paused, or waiting for data.

properties.name: muted
properties.summary: Indicates whether or not audio output of the player is muted.
properties.description: Only affects audio muting for the player instance and not for the device.

properties.name: paused
properties.summary: Boolean indicating if audio playback is paused.

properties.name: playing
properties.summary: Boolean indicating if audio is currently playing.
properties.description: Returns false if playback is stopped or paused.

properties.name: progress
properties.summary: Current playback progress, in milliseconds.
properties.description: Returns zero if bitRate has not yet been detected.

properties.name: rate
properties.summary: Indicates the desired rate of playback; 0.0 means "paused", 1.0 indicates a desire to play at the natural rate of the current item. In addition, 2.0 would mean that the audio plays twice as fast.
properties.description: Setting the value of rate to 0.0 pauses playback, causing the value of the state property change to AUDIO_STATE_PAUSED. Setting the rate to a non-zero value causes the value of the state property to become either AUDIO_STATE_WAITING_FOR_QUEUE or AUDIO_STATE_PLAYING, depending on whether sufficient media data has been buffered for playback to occur and whether the player's default behavior of waiting in order to minimize stalling is permitted.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: Current state of playback, specified using one of the STATE constants defined on this object.

properties.name: time
properties.summary: Current playback position of the audio.

properties.name: url
properties.summary: URL for the audio stream.

properties.name: volume
properties.summary: Volume of the audio, from 0.0 (muted) to 1.0 (loudest).
properties.description:
This setting controls the volume of the sound relative to the overall volume setting for the device.

On iOS, to adjust the volume of the device, set the volume property of appMusicPlayer and set the audioSessionCategory property to either AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_AMBIENT, AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_SOLO_AMBIENT, or AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_PLAYBACK.

properties.name: waiting
properties.summary: Boolean indicating if the playback is waiting for audio data from the network.
properties.description: This property is true if the player is in any of the waiting states, including buffering, starting, waiting for data, and waiting for queue.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_ALARM
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for alarms.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_MEDIA
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for media playback.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_NOTIFICATION
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for notifications.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_RING
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for the phone ring.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_SIGNALLING
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for DTMF tones or beeps.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_VOICE
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for voice calls.

constants.name: STATE_BUFFERING
constants.summary: Audio data is being buffered from the network.

constants.name: STATE_WAITING_FOR_DATA
constants.summary: Player is waiting for audio data from the network.

constants.name: STATE_WAITING_FOR_QUEUE
constants.summary: Player is waiting for audio data to fill the queue.
